title: Facerelight requirements installation and running errors.
body:
For some reason pip install requirements-cuda.txt gives this error out:
ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement requirements.txt (from versions: none)
ERROR: No matching distribution found for requirements.txt

I managed to install all requirements manually by typing pip install:
numpy==1.17.0
h5py==2.9.0
Keras==2.2.4
opencv-python==4.1.0.25
plaidml==0.6.0
plaidml-keras==0.5.0
scikit-image
tqdm
ffmpeg-python==0.1.17

and

pip install torch===1.3.1 -f https://download.pytorch.org/whl/torch_stable.html
pip install torchvision===0.4.0 -f https://download.pytorch.org/whl/torch_stable.html

not sure what to do with the line:
git+https://www.github.com/keras-team/keras-contrib.git

also any attempt to instal tensorflow-gpu==1.12.0
pip install tensorflow-gpu==1.12.0 gives out error:

ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement tensorflow-gpu==1.12.0 (from versions: 1.13.0rc1, 1.13.0rc2, 1.13.1, 1.13.2, 1.14.0rc0, 1.14.0rc1, 1.14.0, 1.15.0rc0, 1.15.0rc1, 1.15.0rc2, 1.15.0rc3, 1.15.0, 2.0.0a0, 2.0.0b0, 2.0.0b1, 2.0.0rc0, 2.0.0rc1, 2.0.0rc2, 2.0.0)
ERROR: No matching distribution found for tensorflow-gpu==1.12.0

So I installed 2.0.0 pip install tensorflow-gpu==2.0.0, it uninstalled previous ones and installed this one succesfully:

Installing collected packages: opt-einsum, cachetools, pyasn1, rsa, pyasn1-modules, google-auth, oauthlib, requests-oauthlib, google-auth-oauthlib, tensorboard, gast, tensorflow-estimator, tensorflow-gpu
  Found existing installation: tensorboard 1.14.0
    Uninstalling tensorboard-1.14.0:
      Successfully uninstalled tensorboard-1.14.0
  Found existing installation: gast 0.3.2
    Uninstalling gast-0.3.2:
      Successfully uninstalled gast-0.3.2
  Found existing installation: tensorflow-estimator 1.14.0
    Uninstalling tensorflow-estimator-1.14.0:
      Successfully uninstalled tensorflow-estimator-1.14.0
  Found existing installation: tensorflow-gpu 1.14.0
    Uninstalling tensorflow-gpu-1.14.0:
      Successfully uninstalled tensorflow-gpu-1.14.0
Successfully installed cachetools-3.1.1 gast-0.2.2 google-auth-1.7.1 google-auth-oauthlib-0.4.1 oauthlib-3.1.0 opt-einsum-3.1.0 pyasn1-0.4.7 pyasn1-modules-0.2.7 requests-oauthlib-1.3.0 rsa-4.0 tensorboard-2.0.1 tensorflow-estimator-2.0.1 tensorflow-gpu-2.0.0

Then I tried running face relight but I'm still getting the following error:

Lighten the faces? ( y/n default:n ?:help ) :
n
Choose light directions manually? ( y/n default:y ) :
y
Collecting fileinfo: 100%|########################################################| 1209/1209 [00:03<00:00, 302.65it/s]
Using PyTorch backend.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "F:\DF\1.DFLAVX10.1_14.11\_internal\DeepFaceLab\main.py", line 302, in <module>
    arguments.func(arguments)
  File "F:\DF\1.DFLAVX10.1_14.11\_internal\DeepFaceLab\main.py", line 278, in process_relight_faceset
    FacesetRelighter.relight (arguments.input_dir, arguments.lighten, arguments.random_one)
  File "F:\DF\1.DFLAVX10.1_14.11\_internal\DeepFaceLab\mainscripts\FacesetRelighter.py", line 206, in relight
    dpr = DeepPortraitRelighting()
  File "F:\DF\1.DFLAVX10.1_14.11\_internal\DeepFaceLab\nnlib\DeepPortraitRelighting.py", line 13, in __init__
    nnlib.import_torch()
  File "F:\DF\1.DFLAVX10.1_14.11\_internal\DeepFaceLab\nnlib\nnlib.py", line 148, in import_torch
    import torch
  File "F:\DF\1.DFLAVX10.1_14.11\_internal\python-3.6.8\lib\site-packages\torch\__init__.py", line 81, in <module>
    from torch._C import *
ImportError: DLL load failed
